Essay

  1. BASIC INFORMATION
    1. Most of the people who filled out this questionnaire were undergraduates.
    2. There are about 40% of those people whose major is related to CST.
  2. BASIC CYBERSECURITY KNOWLEDGE
    1. Most people have LIMITED cybersecurity knowledge.
    2. But we found that people are not aware enough about phishing websites.(zhi-hu\https)
    3. More, the ability of identifying the source of information needs to be improved.(ONLY sources of official authority are credible)
  3. EXPERTISE
    1. Everyoneâ€™s expertise is close to zero
    2. But we can see that publicity can play a pretty good role.
  4. ABOUT PASSWORD
    1. For password saving, most people know that the same password is not secure, and few people will choose to use a browser or password manager to manage passwords, but in theory, as long as your computer has not been stolen and there is no password, the password you store in the password manager is safe.
    2. But at the same time, 50% of people often use the same password, and 50% of people do know how browsers store passwords, that is, there are many people who think that the same password is not safe but still knowingly do it, and many people who think they know how browsers store passwords do not actually know.
    3. So learn more about new technologies. Also, vast majority of people do not know what a cryptographic algorithm is, and will confuse passwords and encoding. While, 40% of people are related majors, so peopleâ€™s expertise is very lacking.
  5. PRIVACY
    1. Most people do not know how privacy can be compromised.
